alert.note: Alert for Brazoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 8:31PM CST until January 02 at 1:30PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria and Galveston. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated periods of heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is possible in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... League City, Galveston Island West End, Galveston Causeway, Texas City, Dickinson, La Marque, Santa Fe, Hitchcock, Kemah, Surfside Beach, Bayou Vista, Oyster Creek, Jamaica Beach, Tiki Island, San Luis Pass, Bacliff, San Leon and Kemah Boardwalk. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
